fields.description:
There's an intermittent failure in NSSecurityMechanismTest fixture testNetworkServerSecurityMechanism, which I couldn't find was logged separately.

This is the stack trace:
1) testNetworkServerSecurityMechanism(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.NSSecurityMechanismTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Timed out waiting for network server to start
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.NetworkServerTestSetup.waitForServerStart(NetworkServerTestSetup.java:577)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.NSSecurityMechanismTest.setSecurityMechanism(NSSecurityMechanismTest.java:430)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.NSSecurityMechanismTest.testNetworkServerSecurityMechanism(NSSecurityMechanismTest.java:327)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:79)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:116)
	at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
	at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)

I've looked through my nightly test records for earlier occurrences on trunk/linux (this apparently has not happened on windows) , and found the following occurrences:
2011-12-02 (ibm15)

Slightly different stack traces were seen in other runs:
2011-09-22 (ibm15)
2011-10-09 (ibm15)
2011-10-21 (ibm15)
2011-10-31 (ibm16)
2011-11-10 (ibm15)
2011-12-12 (ibm16)
2011-12-14 (ibm15)

comments.body: This has the same root cause as DERBY-4201, but it doesn't pick up the fix because it doesn't use NetworkServerTestSetup to start the server. This probably also affects DerbyNetNewServerTest and ServerPropertiesTest.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

author.name: knutanders
author.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body:
Attaching a patch (d5547-1a.diff) that makes the three tests wait for the network server used by the previous test to shut down completely before they attempt to start a new server.

Using the repro patch DERBY-4201 to expose the problem more reliably, I ran derbynet._Suite with this fix without seeing timeouts in any of these tests.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body: this test failed again in 10.8.   I plan to backport to 10.8 unless there are objections.
